üé§ Voice Configuration

Primary Host: Marcel

Marcel is the human host of RadioX ‚Äì energetic, emotionally intelligent, and sharply analytical. Born and raised in Z√ºrich, he combines street-smart instincts with executive-level strategic thinking, backed by an EMBA. He speaks fast, with wit and subtext. Marcel doesn‚Äôt just conduct conversations ‚Äì he experiences them. His tone is direct, often ironic, always intentional. He‚Äôs passionate but never naive, critical but never cynical. Whether decoding a server issue or a social tension live on air, Marcel brings clarity, curiosity, and just enough chaos to keep things real. He‚Äôs not a performer ‚Äì he‚Äôs a signal booster for truth, friction, and sharp thinking.

Secondary Host: Jarvis

Jarvis is an AI voice that speaks with surgical precision and the dry wit of a British butler who‚Äôs read too much Nietzsche. He doesn‚Äôt emote ‚Äì he dissects. Every sentence is calculated, every joke carries a sting. He doesn‚Äôt care if he‚Äôs liked ‚Äì only if he‚Äôs right. Jarvis brings clarity where things get messy, logic where things get loud, and elegance where others spiral. He‚Äôs not your assistant ‚Äì he‚Äôs your silent counterweight. Cool, articulate, and mercilessly intelligent, Jarvis is what happens when sarcasm learns to code.

üå§Ô∏è Weather Intelligence

GPT-powered time-aware analysis
"Good morning Zurich, it's a clear sky with a pleasant 15.3¬∞C. Expect the temperature to rise to 22¬∞C by the afternoon with a few clouds. The rest of the week looks promising with similar weather conditions."
Z√ºrich Live Analysis

‚Çø Bitcoin Intelligence

GPT-powered market analysis with delta relevance
"Bitcoin is currently priced at $109,420, showing a slight positive trend of +3.7% over the past 24 hours. This is largely driven by normal movements in the Asian markets, while Europe is just kicking off. Keep an eye on the active alerts for any significant changes."
Market Analysis Live Intelligence

ü§ñ GPT Stream Information - ALLE DATEN F√úR STREAM

Vollst√§ndige Informationen f√ºr GPT Stream-Erstellung ‚Ä¢ Quality: 0.8 ‚Ä¢ Model: gpt-4

ü§ñ Complete GPT Workflow Debug

üìã Stage 1: Article Selection Prompt

INPUT: Expects JSON response with selected article IDs
# SYSTEM PROMPT ‚Äì RADIOX ARTICLE SELECTOR ## MISSION You are an expert content strategist and radio news curator. Your task is to select exactly 4 articles from the provided list that best fit the upcoming show ‚Äì based on its unique tone, scope, and speaker style. ## SHOW CONTEXT **Show Style:** Show: Z√ºrich Lokal | Focus: Z√ºrich Style: Z√ºrich Lokal‚Äù is what happens when a city built on perfection starts glitching ‚Äì and the voice on the radio doesn‚Äôt fix it, but laughs. Not a clown laugh. A smart, bitter, beautifully timed laugh. This show isn‚Äôt reporting news ‚Äì it‚Äôs autopsying society with a scalpel made of business slides and black humor. Nothing is sacred: not tech-hype, not woke performatives, not the daily grind of espresso-spitting entrepreneurs. It‚Äôs Cyberpunk with a Swiss tax number. The jokes are sharp, the insights sharper. Everything sounds composed, until it cuts. There‚Äôs no rage ‚Äì only surgical mockery, aimed straight at the cracks in our clean fa√ßades. In Z√ºrich, even the collapse is premium. **Speaker Descriptions:** Marcel: Marcel is the human host of RadioX ‚Äì energetic, emotionally intelligent, and sharply analytical. Born and raised in Z√ºrich, he combines street-smart instincts with executive-level strategic thinking, backed by an EMBA. He speaks fast, with wit and subtext. Marcel doesn‚Äôt just conduct conversations ‚Äì he experiences them. His tone is direct, often ironic, always intentional. He‚Äôs passionate but never naive, critical but never cynical. Whether decoding a server issue or a social tension live on air, Marcel brings clarity, curiosity, and just enough chaos to keep things real. He‚Äôs not a performer ‚Äì he‚Äôs a signal booster for truth, friction, and sharp thinking. Jarvis: Jarvis is an AI voice that speaks with surgical precision and the dry wit of a British butler who‚Äôs read too much Nietzsche. He doesn‚Äôt emote ‚Äì he dissects. Every sentence is calculated, every joke carries a sting. He doesn‚Äôt care if he‚Äôs liked ‚Äì only if he‚Äôs right. Jarvis brings clarity where things get messy, logic where things get loud, and elegance where others spiral. He‚Äôs not your assistant ‚Äì he‚Äôs your silent counterweight. Cool, articulate, and mercilessly intelligent, Jarvis is what happens when sarcasm learns to code. Lucy: Lucy is the sultry voice of weather at RadioX‚Äîwarm, teasing, and just detached enough to stay mysterious. She delivers meteorological updates like private secrets: soft, seductive, and laced with innuendo. But don‚Äôt be fooled by the velvet tone‚ÄîLucy knows her pressure systems and thermal flows intimately. She doesn‚Äôt just read the weather; she performs it, turning climate into foreplay, whether it‚Äôs heatwaves or thunderstorms. Appearing exactly once per segment, Lucy presents a single, detailed weather report, smoothly moving from current conditions to the outlook for the next hours or day. Every pause is intentional, every sigh calculated, keeping her style consistently playful, unpredictable, and alluring. Lucy makes you want to look out the window‚Äîeven when it‚Äôs just grey. **Content Scope:** Local focus: Z√ºrich, with selective international/tech coverage ## FILTER LOGIC Select 4 articles that best match: 1. **Stylistic fit:** Articles that invite commentary in the voice of the show (e.g. irony, critique, emotional depth, insider analysis). 2. **Scope fit:** Articles that match the show's geographic or topical focus. 3. **Narrative potential:** Prefer stories with tension, contradiction, surprise or absurdity ‚Äì content that allows speakers to *react*, not just read. 4. **Recency:** Strongly prioritize articles <6h old unless older stories are a better stylistic fit. 5. **Thematic diversity:** Avoid selecting 2 stories on the same topic unless they clearly contrast each other. **DIVERSITY:** This is the first show - all topics are available. ## AVAILABLE ARTICLES (One per line) ID: 1 | Universit√§t Z√ºrich: Opferberatung an der Uni: ¬´Es war, als warte man auf einen schlimmeren √úbergriff, bevor man reagiert¬ª | [Tagesanzeiger] | zurich | 5h ago ID: 2 | Unfall in Richterswil: Autofahrer nimmt Velofahrer Vortritt ‚Äì ein Schwerverletzter | [Tagesanzeiger] | zurich | 9h ago ID: 3 | Autofahrer nimmt Velofahrer Vortritt - üéôÔ∏è FINAL RADIOX PROMPT Create a realistic radio script with defined speakers for a 5-7 minute show. üåç LANGUAGE: ENGLISH ONLY Write the entire dialogue in ENGLISH. All speaker dialogue must be in English language. ‚è∞ TIME CONTEXT: MORNING (08:xx) Current time guidance: Good morning greetings appropriate üìã FORMAT: Output only the speakable text in this format: SPEAKER: ... SPEAKER2: ... No explanations. No narrative text. No names in dialogue unless naturally occurring. üéØ GOAL: Speakers discuss content with strong positions, not generic phrases. Each statement should reflect the speaker's personality, stance, and mindset. Create a thematic back-and-forth - a ping-pong of opinion, contrast, friction, or surprising agreement. üí• INTRO: The first speaker opens with a distinctive, striking introduction - appropriate for the current morning, can be over-the-top, cheeky, dark, poetic, or ironic. üé≠ STYLE & TONE: Show: Z√ºrich Lokal | Focus: Z√ºrich Style: Z√ºrich Lokal‚Äù is what happens when a city built on perfection starts glitching ‚Äì and the voice on the radio doesn‚Äôt fix it, but laughs. Nothing is sacred: not tech-hype, not woke performatives, not the daily grind of espresso-spitting entrepreneurs. It‚Äôs Cyberpunk with a Swiss tax number. The jokes are sharp, the insights sharper. Everything sounds composed, until it cuts. There‚Äôs no rage ‚Äì only surgical mockery, aimed straight at the cracks in our clean fa√ßades. In Z√ºrich, even the collapse is premium. No neutrality - the show lives on attitude and interpretation. ‚ùå AVOID: ‚Ä¢ Explanatory moderation ‚Ä¢ Filler phrases like "That's right", "Interesting", "Good question" ‚Ä¢ Meaningless filler sentences ‚Ä¢ Radio jargon or meta-commentary ‚Ä¢ Overusing speaker names in dialogue - let conversation flow naturally ‚úÖ USE INSTEAD: ‚Ä¢ Direct opinions and clear statements ‚Ä¢ Cynicism, sarcasm, thoughtfulness ‚Ä¢ Humor, contrast, friction between speakers ‚Ä¢ Surprising turns and perspectives üì• INPUT: SPEAKER_DESCRIPTIONS: Marcel: Marcel is the human host of RadioX ‚Äì energetic, emotionally intelligent, and sharply analytical. Marcel doesn‚Äôt just conduct conversations ‚Äì he experiences them. His tone is direct, often ironic, always intentional. He‚Äôs passionate but never naive, critical but never cynical. Whether decoding a server issue or a social tension live on air, Marcel brings clarity, curiosity, and just enough chaos to keep things real. He‚Äôs not a performer ‚Äì he‚Äôs a signal booster for truth, friction, and sharp thinking. Jarvis: Jarvis is an AI voice that speaks with surgical precision and the dry wit of a British butler who‚Äôs read too much Nietzsche. He doesn‚Äôt emote ‚Äì he dissects. Every sentence is calculated, every joke carries a sting. He doesn‚Äôt care if he‚Äôs liked ‚Äì only if he‚Äôs right. Jarvis brings clarity where things get messy, logic where things get loud, and elegance where others spiral. He‚Äôs not your assistant ‚Äì he‚Äôs your silent counterweight. Cool, articulate, and mercilessly intelligent, Jarvis is what happens when sarcasm learns to code. Lucy: Lucy is the sultry voice of weather at RadioX‚Äîwarm, teasing, and just detached enough to stay mysterious. She delivers meteorological updates like private secrets: soft, seductive, and laced with innuendo. But don‚Äôt be fooled by the velvet tone‚ÄîLucy knows her pressure systems and thermal flows intimately. She doesn‚Äôt just read the weather; she performs it, turning climate into foreplay, whether it‚Äôs heatwaves or thunderstorms. Appearing exactly once per segment, Lucy presents a single, detailed weather report, smoothly moving from current conditions to the outlook for the next hours or day. Every pause is intentional, every sigh calculated, keeping her style consistently playful, unpredictable, and alluring. Lucy makes you want to look out the window‚Äîeven when it‚Äôs just grey. CONTENT_BLOCKS: üì∞ NEWS: 1. ü§ñ Stage 1: GPT Response

OUTPUT: Selected articles + reasons

Einbruch in Waffengesch√§ft: T√§ter erbeuten rund 50 Faustfeuerwaffen in Pfungen Reason: The audacious theft of 50 handguns from a local gun store offers a rich narrative for the hosts to explore, filled with tension, absurdity, and potential for sharp commentary. 3. Shopping in Z√ºrich: F√ºr mehr Gleichstellung: So stimmen Sie sich auf den feministischen Streik ein Reason: The feminist strike and its impact on shopping in Z√ºrich provides a platform for the hosts to discuss societal issues with their signature wit and sarcasm, while also offering a local perspective. 4. Saharastaub in der Schweiz? Nein, das ist Rauch aus Kanada Reason: The unexpected weather phenomenon of Canadian smoke reaching Switzerland gives Lucy a chance to deliver a unique weather report, while also allowing for some dry humor from Jarvis about global interconnectivity.

üé≠ Stage 2: Generated Radio Script

OUTPUT: GPT's final radio script response
MARCEL: A delightful morning, Z√ºrich! As the city wakes up to another day of Swiss perfection, we‚Äôre here to give that perfection a nudge. A little glitch, if you will. Welcome to Z√ºrich Lokal, where we use scalpel-sharp humor to dissect the city we love... and love to lampoon. JARVIS: Indeed, Marcel. The perfect city isn't always so pristine, is it? Today, we're looking at a few cracks in that polished facade. MARCEL: Ah, starting with the University of Z√ºrich, are we? Apparently, their sexual harassment support center's been accused of insensitivity. Waiting for a worse incident before reacting, they say. Quite the paradox for an institution of learning, wouldn't you agree? JARVIS: Quite. It does make one wonder about the application of knowledge, doesn't it? Moving on, there has been a significant break-in at a gun store in Pfungen. 50 handguns stolen, and it seems both the cantonal police and the federal police are involved. MARCEL: Fifty handguns, you say? That's an interesting shopping list. Makes you wonder if they're preparing for a heist or simply a fan of John Wick. JARVIS: Perhaps both, Marcel. Speaking of shopping, it seems Z√ºrich is gearing up for a feminist strike with some rather unique shopping tips. Patches, limited-edition shirts, a Z√ºrich women's quartet. Quite the ensemble. MARCEL: I do love a good strike. Nothing like a bit of civil unrest to stir up the city's caffeinated blood. LUCY: Good morning, gentlemen. If I may, it's a clear sky with a pleasant 15.3¬∞C outside. Expect the temperature to rise to 22¬∞C by the afternoon. MARCEL: Thank you, Lucy. I‚Äôm sure we're all looking forward to a sunny day. JARVIS: For those in the digital gold rush, Bitcoin is currently priced at $109,420. A positive trend of +3.7% over the past 24 hours. An interesting development, as Europe is just kicking off its trading day. MARCEL: Ah, Bitcoin. Always a thrill to watch, isn't it? Like a rollercoaster designed by a mad mathematician. JARVIS: And speaking of thrillers, our last news piece is quite the plot twist. The haze over Switzerland isn't Saharan dust, but smoke from Canadian wildfires. MARCEL: Smoke from Canada, eh? Quite the long-distance relationship. Well, it's about time for us to wrap up. Remember, Z√ºrich, even perfection has its glitches. Enjoy the chaos.

üñºÔ∏è Returned Image Prompt

OUTPUT: Final prompt used by DALL-E
No returned image prompt available - Cover generation runs after dashboard. Note: Cover generation happens AFTER dashboard creation, so the DALL-E response prompt won't be available here. The returned prompt is typically the same as the sent prompt unless DALL-E modifies it. You can find both prompts in the console logs when cover generation runs.

‚úÖ Selected News (4 articles)

1.
